definition: spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to cover/to overflow/to overturn/to capsize
surname Shui
water/river/liquid/beverage/additional charges or income/(of clothes) classifier for number of washes
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)

sentences.english: Last year's dispute is water under the bridge now.
sentences.chinese: 去年的争论已经是覆水难收了。

sentences.english: You all know the expression, ? "Don't cry over spilt milk." Right?
sentences.chinese: 你们都知道有句话叫做，“覆水难收“，对吗？

definition: irrevocable/the die is cast
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: irreversible

lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: The issue is in the past, and the situation has changed (idiom)./It is water under the bridge.
spilt water/(fig.) sth that can not be retrieved/spilt milk
to part without hard feelings (idiom)/to cut the knot as smoothly as you tied it
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to regret one's past deeds (idiom)
to be estranged
if you ride a tiger, it's hard to get off (idiom); fig. impossible to stop halfway

nothing sadder than a withered heart (idiom attributed to Confucius by Zhuangzi 莊子|庄子[Zhuang1 zi3])/no greater sorrow than a heart that never rejoices/the worst sorrow is not as bad as an uncaring heart/nothing is more wretched than apathy
pinyin: ai1 mo4 da4 yu2 xin1 si3

definition: (literary) stranger
lit. to rein in the horse at the edge of the precipice (idiom)/fig. to act in the nick of time
to make a decision when it's time to decide
to repent/remorse
